verses.roman:
āśraya-jātiya sukha pāite mana dhāya
yatne āsvādite nāri, ki kari upāya

synonyms: āśraya-jātīya—relating to the abode; sukha—happiness; pāite—to obtain; mana—the mind; dhāya—chases; yatne—by effort; āsvādite—to taste; nāri—I am unable; ki—what; kari—I do; upāya—way.
translation: "My mind races to taste the pleasure experienced by the abode, but I cannot taste it, even by My best efforts. How may I taste it?
